item.title: NACC chief executive apologises to parliament for inaccurate evidence

item.description: Staff have been evacuated from a remote boarding school on the Tiwi Islands, and students may not be able to return to classrooms this year, after Ex-Tropical Cyclone Fina tore through the region with devastating force on Saturday night.

item.title: South Africa defeat India by 408 runs in second Test match, win series 2-0
item.description: South Africa has clinched its first Test series win in India in 25 years with a crushing 408-run win in the second Test, claiming a 2-0 series sweep.

item.description: Floods across nine Thai provinces have killed 33 people and affected more than 2.7 million, with more rain forecast.

item.description: The Melbourne Stars will carry solid momentum into Saturday's big WBBL local derby, easily beating top side Hobart by 37 runs.

item.title: Man accused of international student's murder 'likely' had intellectual disability, court hears
item.description: A neuropsychologist has told the Northern Territory Supreme Court a man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin "likely" had an intellectual disability that impacted his ability to exercise self-control.

item.title: US National Parks to raise fees for millions of international tourists to popular sites
item.description: Changes set to take effect on January 1 will include annual park passes jumping to $US250 for foreign tourists, while US residents will continue to be charged $US80, according to authorities.

item.description: Fires that have burnt through the night are yet to be extinguished as firefighters struggle to reach those in need.

item.description: It comes as a senior Kremlin official confirms Steve Witkoff is set to visit Moscow next week as efforts to find a consensus on ending the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine pick up speed.

item.description: The abandonment of the Georgia case is the latest reflection of how the US president has emerged largely unscathed from a spate of prosecutions that once threatened to imperil his political career.

item.title: Labor is celebrating a successful year but tough budget choices lie ahead
item.description: The level of the prime minister's reform appetite has been discussed and debated since roughly 9pm on election night in May, when Labor's massive win became clear.

item.title: Black Friday puts 'social pressure' on shoppers as more Australians rack up credit card debt
item.description: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

item.title: London Broncos rugby league hopes buoyed by Brisbane icon Darren Lockyer and players from PNG
item.description: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

item.description: If the electorate were to vote strongly against the government, it would sting first-term leader David Crisafulli and be spun as a rejection of the LNP's agenda, writes Alex Brewster.

item.title: Here is what we know about Hong Kong's Tai Po fire and the role of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: The blaze in Tai Po that engulfed multiple high-rise apartment blocks is still burning, and authorities say it likely began in bamboo scaffolding that encased the buildings.

item.description: A massive high-rise apartment fire in Hong Kong's Tai Po district has killed at least 55 people and left hundreds more missing, with firefighters continuing to battle the blaze — as it happened.

item.description: Australia is expecting to see its medal chances boosted at the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad as sports such as cricket and hockey remain in contention to return.

item.description: The Thai city of Hat Yai received its heaviest rainfall in 300 years, while mudslides killed dozens on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

item.description: An increased risk of bushfire is expected for parts of the country this summer, with most areas expecting hotter than normal temperatures.

item.description: Jujubes are a relatively unknown fruit for most Australians, but the sweet fruit has strong domestic demand for those looking for a taste of home.

item.title: United States to begin reviewing all asylum cases approved under Joe Biden's presidency
item.description: US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) says it has begun "a full-scale, rigorous re-examination of every Green Card for every alien from every country of concern".

item.title: Former WA police officer Kaine Burgess relives the night his patrol car was rammed
item.description: More than two years on from a serious crash that saw him medically retired, a former police officer says he can still hear the screech of tyres before the deafening bang of a car slamming into his police wagon.

item.title: 'Brumby Bill' protecting heritage value of wild horses to be scrapped in NSW
item.description: A widely criticised bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park will be scrapped in a move celebrated by the Invasive Species Council.

item.title: Estella brings strength and resilience to her family as she navigates life with disability in remote NT
item.description: Nineteen-year-old Estella Jones lives with a disability in her hometown of Tennant Creek, where she loves baking brownies, singing karaoke and spending time with good friends.

item.title: Fuzzy Zoeller, Masters and US Open champion, dies aged 74
item.description: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died aged 74.

item.title: Traditional owners in WA's north challenge state over fast-tracking mining exploration approvals
item.description: Traditional owners in WA's north launch legal action against the state government claiming it is fast-tracking mining and exploration projects using "expedited procedure" approvals at cultural expense.

item.title: France to reintroduce voluntary military service amid growing threat of war with Russia
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is reintroducing voluntary military service almost three decades after it was scrapped.

item.title: Widespread flooding in Hat Yai, southern Thailand
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Inquest concludes into death of SA boatie Tony Higgins
item.description: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

item.title: Common antidepressant helps reduce some men's domestic violence, ReINVEST trial finds
item.description: The findings are significant not just because of how much the trial reduced domestic violence, but because only a few years ago it drew fierce criticism from women's advocates and politicians.

item.title: Benedict Bryant found guilty of dangerous driving causing the death of Jai Kalani Wright
item.description: Benedict Bryant had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death over the crash in inner Sydney in February 2022, which killed Jai Wright.

item.title: Donald Trump says National Guard soldier Sarah Beckstrom has died after being shot in Washington DC
item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died in hospital after an ambush shooting near the White House on Wednesday. A male soldier who was also shot, Andrew Wolfe, is fighting for his life, the president says.

item.title: Christmas prawns could be more expensive as wild-caught Australian seafood stocks drop off
item.description: Wild-caught Aussie prawn fishers are reporting a tough catch season. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Award-winning regional pharmacist says relationship with patients is 'unique'
item.description: A north-west Victorian pharmacist is being celebrated for his contribution to his local community after winning an award for going the "extra mile".

item.title: Super Netball could grow to 10 teams as Netball Australia invites licence bids
item.description: Super Netball could have two additional teams by 2027, with Netball Australia calling for expressions of interest to expand the competition.

item.title: What time is the 2025 AFLW grand final? All you need to know as Brisbane and North Melbourne clash
item.description: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

item.title: Rare West Australian seaweed scrapbooks provide glimpse into history
item.description: The State Library of WA is running an appeal to save a set of seaweed scrapbooks made nearly 100 years ago by a renowned Kalgoorlie-born naturalist.

item.title: Hong Kong building fire prompts serious questions about construction safety
item.description: Just months ago, Hong Kong leaders were dismissing calls for a total ban on bamboo scaffolding on construction sites. Now they are facing one of the region's worst building-fire catastrophes, and anger is growing.

item.title: Why the banking regulator is targeting property investors
item.description: It's been called a bubble for more than 15 years but the great Aussie housing price boom has barely skipped a beat, as regulators eye the threat of risky loans.

item.title: Victorian regulator imposes conditions on Monash IVF after embryo bungles
item.description: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

item.title: Regional newspaper printer facing uncertain future in modern media market
item.description: With Broken Hill's Barrier Truth newspaper in the process of selling off its usable assets, some wonder if its still-working press would be more valuable as scrap or even a museum piece.

item.title: Jane Edmanson hangs up her Gardening Australia hat, reflects on labour of love behind show's success
item.description: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

item.title: New Victorian opposition leader Jess Wilson targets coercive control in first major policy move
item.description: Jess Wilson has announced her first policy as leader of the Liberal Party, promising to introduce legislation criminalising coercive control in Victoria.

item.title: Berkeley River Lodge caretakers survived 'apocalyptic' Cyclone Fina in underground bunker
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: French prisoners escape jail using saw and bedsheets
item.description: The fugitives broke out of the prison in the eastern city of Dijon in the early hours of Thrusday, local time, and 100 police officers are on their trail.

item.title: Locals begin clean up after floods inundate Sumatra, Indonesia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: F1 Qatar start time, how to watch grand prix, and drivers' championship standings
item.description: Lando Norris has match point heading into the penultimate weekend of the Formula 1 season, with the British driver having one hand on a maiden drivers' championship.

item.title: Doctors and nurses claim ramping protocol gives ambulance patients priority access to ED, but paramedics disagree
item.description: Medical experts fear sick or injured Tasmanians who make their own way to emergency departments wait longer than others, due to pressures to fast-track ambulance patients.

item.title: Dairy 'disrupter' wins science award for inventing spreadable butter in 1970s
item.description: An 86-year-old farmer claims this year's Dairy Science Award for inventing spreadable butter, by mixing oils with cultured cream at a time when it was illegal.

item.title: Large police operation underway in Blacktown after man shot dead, two arrested
item.description: A man aged in his 20s has died after being shot multiple times near a police station in Western Sydney.

item.title: Third renewable energy company discovers asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts
item.description: An anti-asbestos advocate wants a review of import supply chains after a third renewable energy company confirmed the discovery of asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts.

item.title: Australia names unchanged squad for second Ashes Test, with captain Pat Cummins still out
item.description: Australia will go into the second Ashes Test against England in Brisbane next week with an unchanged line-up, meaning there is no place for captain Pat Cummins.

item.title: City of Perth in turmoil as acting CEO quits amid dispute over Lord Mayor's workplace culture review
item.description: The City of Perth is in turmoil amid a dispute over newly elected Lord Mayor Bruce Reynolds's push for a ratepayer-funded workplace culture review, with the council's acting CEO resigning amid the saga.

item.title: Tasmania's education department and RSB Travel charged over child's attempt to drink engine coolant
item.description: Tasmania's education department and a bus company have both appeared in court after a child with a disability was allegedly left unattended on a bus with access to a bottle of engine coolant in a plastic water bottle.

item.title: Pheobe Bishop accused faces court on a fresh charge
item.description: Kieren Daniel Mittelheuser has been charged with attempting to pervert justice, along with accessory to murder.

item.title: Corporate Travel Management embroiled in overcharging scandal potentially worth more than $100 million
item.description: Corporate Travel Management helps arrange travel bookings for clients ranging from Wesfarmers to the Australian government.

item.title: Whadjuk Aboriginal Corporation to oversee Rottnest Island cultural services
item.description: A strife-torn Aboriginal corporation crucial to heritage approvals across Perth wins a contract to oversee cultural services on Rottnest Island, Wadjemup, one of Western Australia's premier tourism destinations.

item.title: Kangaroos coach Darren Crocker opens up on difficult Mia King selection call ahead of AFLW grand final
item.description: North Melbourne coach Darren Crocker says telling Mia King she isn't going to play in the AFLW grand final is "one of the harder conversations" he's had to have.

item.title: Shopping centre stabbing leaves teen with life-threatening injuries and another in custody
item.description: A teenage boy is in hospital with life-threatening injuries after a stabbing at an Adelaide shopping centre in which a 20-year-old man was also injured.

item.title: Victims' families of Westfield Bondi Junction attack grateful for inquest but want 'reforms'
item.description: A lawyer representing one of the bereaved families took aim at the owner and operator of Westfield, saying they were "extremely disappointed".

item.title: A crystal Fabergé egg is expected to sell for more than $40 million
item.description: A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg is heading to auction with a price estimate of more than $40 million.

item.title: Jury hears closing addresses in trial of man accused of murdering Bangladeshi student
item.description: The jury in the trial of a Tiwi Islands man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin hears final arguments from the prosecution and the defence.

item.title: 'Rare' cyclone in Indonesia among wild weather in South-East Asia that kills at least 115
item.description: The death toll is expected to continue rising after a week of record-breaking rain, flash flooding and a "rare" tropical cyclone.

item.title: Toyah Cordingley's accused killer '3.7 billion times more likely than not' to have contributed to DNA sample near burial site, court told
item.description: The former nurse accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley was 3.7 billion times more likely than not to have contributed to a DNA sample found on a stick where she was buried, his trial has heard.

item.title: Donald Trump says America will pause all migration from 'Third World countries'
item.description: US President Donald Trump says his administration will work to permanently pause migration from all "Third World Countries" to allow the American system to fully recover.

item.title: Tasmanian government criticised for not signing up to federal Help to Buy home ownership scheme
item.description: Tasmania is the only state or territory that is not joining the federal government's Help to Buy home ownership scheme, which aims to reduce the time it takes home buyers to save for a deposit.

item.title: Legal battle begins over Virginia Giuffre’s multi-million-dollar estate
item.description: A legal battle over the reported multi-million-dollar estate of Virginia Giuffre, who was abused by US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, is underway in Western Australia.

item.title: Preparing my garden for time away in summer
item.description: Leaving my garden in the heat of summer can feel worrying but some simple planning means it misses me less than I miss it.

item.title: Police believe stabbing at Elizabeth City Centre was not a random attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Struggling AFLW teams GWS, Collingwood and Gold Coast receive extra picks or list spots from league
item.description: Three of the AFLW's worst-performing clubs will receive boosts to their lists, with the help announced the day before the grand final.

item.title: Lotterywest cancels licences of seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco or vapes
item.description: Seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco and vapes have their lotteries licences terminated, as attempts to disrupt the illicit and growing trade continues.

item.title: Boy won't face charges after Melbourne primary school stabbing, police say
item.description: Police say a boy who allegedly stabbed a child at a Berwick primary school will not face charges as he is under the age of criminal responsibility.

item.title: Perth hacker Michael Clapsis jailed after setting up fake Qantas Wi-Fi, stealing sex videos
item.description: A Perth hacker who copied intimate images and sex videos from women's personal online accounts and set up fake Wi-Fi on Qantas flights is sentenced to more than seven years in prison.

item.title: Kyra Cooney-Cross scores stunning long range goal as Matildas down New Zealand 5-0
item.description: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

item.title: Hong Kong's aging towers face urgent questions after city's deadliest blaze in decades
item.description: Hong Kong's worst fire in decades exposed long-standing weaknesses in its aging residential blocks. The question haunting the city is whether the disaster could happen again.

item.title: One of seven Rosenberg's goannas from ACT reserve is missing from home for second time in two years
item.description: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki wins Supercars grand final sprint race as Chad Mostert narrows gap to leader Broc Feeney
item.description: Brodie Kostecki prevails in wet and wild conditions to win the opening Supercars grand final race, as Chaz Mostert closes in on the championship lead.

item.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA
item.description: An on-country youth diversion facility has been built in the state's far north, offering a culturally grounded alternative to traditional youth justice programs.

item.title: Confidence remains in WA iron ore industry despite forecast royalty drop
item.description: Western Australia has long prospered off its hefty irone ore mining royalties, but new figures reveal that revenue may drop by billions.

item.title: Qantas terminal at Melbourne Airport evacuated and flights delayed due to fire
item.description: The Qantas terminal is re-opening after being evacuated because of a small fire inside Melbourne Airport.

item.title: NT parliament hears claims of children in youth detention being transferred without families' knowledge
item.description: Two politicians allege NT children in youth detention are being moved from Alice Springs to Darwin without their families' knowledge.

item.title: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte
item.description: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

item.title: Anti-corruption body arrests eight people over deadly Hong Kong fire in Tai Po district that killed at least 128 people
item.description: The arrests come as the probe into what caused the deadly blaze that killed at least 128 people continues.

item.title: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines
item.description: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines

item.title: Home of Andrii Yermak, Zelenskyy's chief of staff, raided by anti-corruption unit
item.description: The raids come as Kyiv battles to persuade US officials to defend Ukraine's interests in peace agreement talks.
